sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The vvorming of a mad dogge: or, A soppe for Cerberus the iaylor of Hell No confutation but a sharpe redargution of the bayter of women. By Constantia Munda Munda, Constantia.
[8], 35, [3] p.
Printed [by George Purslowe] for Laurence Hayes, and are to be sold at his shop neere Fleet-bridge, ouer against St. Brides Lane, London : 1617.
Constantia Munda is a pseudonym. A reply to: Swetnam, Joseph. The araignment of lewde, idle, froward, and unconstant women. Running title reads: The worming of a madde dogge. The last leaf is blank. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

Printed [by George Purslowe] for Laurence Hayes, and are to be sold at his shop neere Fleet-bridge, ouer against St. Brides Lane, London : 1617.
Constantia Munda is a pseudonym. A reply to: Swetnam, Joseph. The araignment of lewde, idle, froward, and unconstant women. Running title reads: The worming of a madde dogge. The last leaf is blank. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
